PYLIE

An instantiation-free python library for common matrix Lie group operations. Functions in this repo operate entirely on numpy arrays, with the intention of minimizing overhead and keeping the implementation as simple as possible.

All class methods are static. This allows for an easy, simple, consistent, instantiation-free use of the library.

Contents:

  • Introduction

Example

from pylie import SE2
import numpy as np

# Random pose
T = SE2.random()

# R^n to group directly (using "Capital" notation)
x = np.array([0.1, 2, 3])
T = SE2.Exp(x)

# Group to R^n directly
x = SE2.Log(T)

# Wedge, vee
Xi = SE2.wedge(x)
x = SE2.vee(Xi)

# Actual exp/log maps
T = SE2.exp(Xi)
Xi = SE2.log(T)

# Adjoint representation of group element
A = SE2.adjoint(T)

# Group left/right jacobians
J_L = SE2.left_jacobian(x)
J_R = SE2.right_jacobian(x)
J_L_inv = SE2.left_jacobian_inv(x)
J_R_inv = SE2.right_jacobian_inv(x)

# odot operator (defined such that wedge(a) * b = odot(b) * a)
b = np.array([1, 2, 3])
B = SE2.odot(b)

Full Documentation

Click on the table entries below to go to each class’ documentation.

pylie.SO2

An instantiation-free implementation of the SO2 matrix Lie group.

pylie.SO3

An instantiation-free implementation of the SO3 matrix Lie group.

pylie.SE2

An instantiation-free implementation of the SE2 matrix Lie group.

pylie.SE3

An instantiation-free implementation of the SE3 matrix Lie group.

pylie.SE23

An instantiation-free implementation of the SE_2(3) matrix Lie group.

pylie.SL3

An instantiation-free implementation of the SL3 matrix Lie group.

pylie.MatrixLieGroup

Base class inherited by all groups, providing a few group-general methods.
